abstract.t: This document is a largely self-contained specification of the basic protocol for the Internet electronic mail transport. It consolidates, updates, and clarifies several previous documents, making all or parts of most of the obsolete. It covers the SMTP extension mechanisms and best practices for the contemporary Internet, but does not provide details about particular extensions. Although SMTP was designed as a mail transport and delivery protocol, this specification also contains information that is important to its use as a "mail submission" protocol for "split-UA" mail reading systems and mobile environments.
